Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used to handle the interactions between players and the game in a syncronized way.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Game​(java.util.NavigableMap<java.lang.String,​org.javatuples.Pair<java.util.Scanner,​java.io.PrintWriter>> players)
    Creates a game and orders the players turns in the game in alphabetical order and deals the cards to them.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addLoser​(java.lang.String username)
    Adds a player to the list of players who lost the game so that their turn will be skipped.
    java.lang.String endTurn​(java.lang.String player)
    Ends the turn of the current player and stores the username of the next player as the current player.
    java.lang.String[] getPlayerCards​(java.lang.String username)
    Returns the cards assigned to a specified player.
    java.lang.String getPlayerOrder()
    Returns the turn order for the players in the game.
    Example: For 3 players with usernames nick1, nick2, nick3.
    boolean isAccusationCorrect​(java.lang.String[] cards)
    Checks if the accusation is correct, or if the accusation cards match the mystery cards picked at random by the the server at the beginning of the game.
    java.lang.String makeSuggestion​(java.lang.String[] suggestionAttempt, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String currentPlayer)
    Checks if any of the players in the game have any of the cards that were suggested.
    java.lang.String move​(java.lang.String direction, java.lang.String player)
    Returns the message to be broadcasted to all players to indicate where this player moved.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(java.util.NavigableMap<java.lang.String,​org.javatuples.Pair<java.util.Scanner,​java.io.PrintWriter>> players)
      Creates a game and orders the players turns in the game in alphabetical order and deals the cards to them.
      Parameters:
      players - a NavigableMap of the players in the game.

  • Method Details

    • addLoser

      public void addLoser​(java.lang.String username)
      Adds a player to the list of players who lost the game so that their turn will be skipped.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player that lost the game.

    • makeSuggestion

      public java.lang.String makeSuggestion​(java.lang.String[] suggestionAttempt, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String currentPlayer)
      Checks if any of the players in the game have any of the cards that were suggested. Each player is checked in the order of their turns until a player has a card that matches any of the suggested, then the username of the player that has that card and the card itself is returned as a string with the valuesseparated by a comma.
      Example: "nickname1,place 2".

      If a player has more than one card that matches the suggestion, then the card that is chosen is picked at random. If no one has the card returns null.
      Parameters:
      suggestionAttempt - a string array with the cards of the suggestion.
      username - the username of the player that made the suggestion.
      currentPlayer - the next player to be checked if they have any of the suggested cards.
      Returns:
      the username and card of the first player who has any of the cards suggested or null if no one has any card.

    • isAccusationCorrect

      public boolean isAccusationCorrect​(java.lang.String[] cards)
      Checks if the accusation is correct, or if the accusation cards match the mystery cards picked at random by the the server at the beginning of the game.
      Parameters:
      cards - a string array with the cards of the accusation.
      Returns:
      true if the accusation is correct. False if it is incorrect.

    • getPlayerOrder

      public java.lang.String getPlayerOrder()
      Returns the turn order for the players in the game.
      Example: For 3 players with usernames nick1, nick2, nick3. The returned string is: "ORDEnick1,nick2,nick3"
      Returns:
      a string with the player's username separated by commas.

    • getPlayerCards

      public java.lang.String[] getPlayerCards​(java.lang.String username)
      Returns the cards assigned to a specified player.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player.
      Returns:
      a string array of the cards assigned to this username.

    • move

      public java.lang.String move​(java.lang.String direction, java.lang.String player)
      Returns the message to be broadcasted to all players to indicate where this player moved.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction to move.
      player - the username of the player to move.
      Returns:
      a string with the message to be sent.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if it is not this player's turn.

    • endTurn

      public java.lang.String endTurn​(java.lang.String player)
      Ends the turn of the current player and stores the username of the next player as the current player.
      Parameters:
      player - the username of the player who want to end the turn.
      Returns:
      the username of the next player.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if it is not this player's turn.
